Trait.Label: Each configuration can be associated with one or more targets, and control the way data is collected and displayed for those targets.
Automatically show timeline graphs for targets added to summary screen.
Trait.Hint: When a new target is added to the summary screen, its time graph will also appear if this option is enabled.

Trait.Label: Put Icon in tool tray?
Trait.Hint: Enable this to turn on the tray icon. Minimizing PingPlotter will also show it only in the tray.

Trait.Label: Show "Round Trip Time" row?
Trait.Hint: Should the "Round Trip Time" row be shown on the main graph? This row always matches the final destination (if it's responding), and makes it easier to understand if the route is complete, and what the round trip time is.

Trait.Label: Minimize PingPlotter window ​when​ close command is used
Trait.Hint: If the "X" is hit in the upper right corner, minimize PingPlotter instead of closing it.  Use File -> Exit to close PingPlotter.

Trait.Label: Include Settings name with target / host descriptions
Trait.Hint: When tracing to multiple targets, using multiple named settings, enable this option to differentiate between targets using different settings.

Trait.Label: Warning (yellow) speed
Trait.Hint: The speed at which warning colors occur.

Trait.Label: Critical (red) speed
Trait.Hint: The speed at which error colors occur.

Trait.Label: Draw line to show Min/Max range

Items.Text: Automatically scale to last visible time graph's sample times
Items.Hint: (default) This gives a good ability to compare each hop with others in the same route, since they are scaled together.

Items.Text: Automatically scale to individual graph sample times
Items.Hint: This is useful when you want the best resolution for each individual host.
Set the graph scale manually.  This can be used when bad line conditions make a graph unreadably erratic.

Trait.Name: ClientSettings.CurrentConfig.ClientConfiguration.DisplaySettings.ScaleSampleTimeMS_Editor
Trait.Hint: Set the graph scale manually.  This can be used when bad line conditions make a graph unreadably erratic.

Items.Hint: Turn off graphing of packet loss - on trace and time graphs (Not recommended).
Select the maximum range for the packet loss bars - on both the upper and lower graphs.

Trait.Name: ClientSettings.CurrentConfig.ClientConfiguration.DisplaySettings.LostPacketPc_Editor
Trait.Hint: Select the maximum range for the packet loss bars - on both the upper and lower graphs. Default is 30%.

Trait.Label: Add jitter graph above time graphs?

Items.Text: Automatically scale to individual jitter values

Trait.Name: ClientSettings.CurrentConfig.ClientConfiguration.DisplaySettings.ScaleJitterMS_Editor
Trait.Hint: Enter a Jitter scale, in MS
